golden_diagnosis: Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 10,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia 12,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 9,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 8,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 11,Naxos disease/Naxos disease,Desminopathy/Myopathy, myofibrillar, 1,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 2,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 5,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 1,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 4,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 3,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 6,Desminopathy/Myopathy, myofibrillar, 1,致心律失常性右室发育不良/心肌病（ARVD/C）/Arrhythmogenic right ventriculardysplasia/ cardiomyopathy; ARVD/C,Arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, familial, 13
predict_diagnosis:
1. Cardiomyopathy, specifically hypertrophic or restrictive cardiomyopathy.
2. Congenital heart disease, such as tetralogy of Fallot or transposition of the great vessels.
3. Pulmonary hypertension with right heart failure.
4. Myocarditis or pericarditis, possibly viral or autoimmune in nature.
5. Endocarditis, which could be infective or non-infective.
6. Aortic or mitral valve disease, such as aortic stenosis or mitral valve prolapse.
7. Aortopathy, potentially related to Ehlers-Danlos syndrome or other connective tissue disorders.
8. Liver disease, such as hepatitis, cirrhosis, or biliary atresia, which could explain the hepatic cysts and conjugated hyperbilirubinemia.
9. Cystic fibrosis, which can lead to pancreatic and hepatic involvement, as well as other systemic manifestations.
10. Metabolic disorders, such as Pompe disease or McArdle disease, which could present with cardiomyopathy and muscle weakness.
